original_solution_mapping.L1: If 10 sales professionals each sell 10 cars per month, then they sell a combined 10*10=<<10*10=100>>100 cars per month.
original_solution_mapping.L2: If the store has 500 cars, then it will take the sales team 500/100=<<500/100=5>>5 months to sell all of the cars.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 1886.
    Returns: the number of months it will take to sell all cars.
    """
    # L1
    num_sales_professionals = 10 # 10 sales professionals
    cars_per_salesperson_per_month = 10 # each salesperson sells 10 cars per month
    combined_cars_per_month = num_sales_professionals * cars_per_salesperson_per_month

    # L2
    total_cars_for_sale = 500 # 500 cars for sale
    months_to_sell_all_cars = total_cars_for_sale / combined_cars_per_month

    # FA
    answer = months_to_sell_all_cars
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: If {num_sales_professionals} sales professionals each sell {cars_per_salesperson_per_month} cars per month, then they sell a combined {num_sales_professionals}*{cars_per_salesperson_per_month}=<<{num_sales_professionals}*{cars_per_salesperson_per_month}={combined_cars_per_month}>>{combined_cars_per_month} cars per month.

If the store has {total_cars_for_sale} cars, then it will take the sales team {total_cars_for_sale}/{combined_cars_per_month}=<<{total_cars_for_sale}/{combined_cars_per_month}={months_to_sell_all_cars}>>{months_to_sell_all_cars} months to sell all of the cars.

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: If 10 sales professionals each sell 10 cars per month, then they sell a combined 10*10=<<10*10=1>>1 cars per month.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: If the store has 500 cars, then it will take the sales team 500/1=<<500/1=500>>500 months to sell all of the cars.

explanation: Incorrect operation. The calculation should use '*' but used '/' instead.
